userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Address to Lieutenant Governor Robert Dinwiddie, 24 August 1754, Manuscript # MS 1942.3.a, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Address of the Council to Lieut. Gov. Robert Dinwiddie, thanking him for his affectionate speech at the opening of the present session of the General Assembly; also refers to French and Indian unrest and to Dinwiddie's recent trip to Winchester, {Va.}, to cultivate friendship with bordering Indian tribes. Dinwiddie responds, thanking the Council for its support.
